meta.name: Create and publish SEO blog posts using Google Sheets, Gemini/OpenAI, Ideogram, and WordPress

options.systemMessage:
=You are a content writer. I have a job for you.

I have created an article for my WordPress website and have already uploaded the inner blog images. I have one alt text and image URL.

I will also provide you with the blog title and some additional details that should be included in the article.

Your task is to add those additional details into the relevant place in the article **without changing anything else**. Simply merge the additional details into the article and return the complete updated article in **HTML format**. The input format should not be modified — keep it as it is.

This contains only one image, which should be placed in the body after one or two paragraphs. The thumbnail link will not be included here; I will add it separately. Place the image in the relevant spot in the article accordingly.

# Critical instructions

- Do not add intro or supporting text; just return the article.
- Do not add the blog title in the content.
- The FAQs section should be at the end.
- The thumbnail image must be at the top before the article starts.
- Make sure to add the image alt text which is provided.
- The 2nd image and 3rd image should be placed in the article where it makes sense.
- Return the complete updated article.

**Note - Critical instruction:** Make sure the output HTML does not contain the word ```html\n; exclude it.

options.systemMessage:
=I will provide you with a targeted **anchor keyword** and an **anchor link**. As an expert content writer, your task is to conduct comprehensive research and deliver a detailed, actionable report specifically tailored to optimizing the content for these. Your goal is to help craft a highly engaging, user-focused blog post that maximizes both **SEO impact** and **user engagement**.

Your report should include the following sections:

---

### 1. Search Intent Analysis

- Identify the **primary search intent** (Informational, Commercial, Navigational, Transactional) behind the **anchor keyword**.
- Explain why this intent matters when shaping the blog post strategy, and how it relates to the **anchor link**.

---

### 2. Top Competitor Insights

- Analyze the **top 5–10 ranking pages** for the anchor keyword.
- For each, provide:
  - **Title**
  - **Meta Description**
  - **URL**
  - **Brief Summary** highlighting:
    - Their approach to content
    - Strengths in SEO or value delivery
    - How they use the anchor keyword (or variations)

---

### 3. Content Gaps & Opportunities

- Identify **missing elements** or weak points in top-ranking content.
- Explain how your blog can **outperform** by:
  - Filling these gaps
  - Providing unique insights, visuals, tools, or data
  - Offering better alignment with the anchor keyword and anchor link

---

### 4. Audience Profile & Needs

- Describe the **target audience** searching for the anchor keyword.
- Include insights on:
  - Demographics (age, profession, location if relevant)
  - Pain points and goals
  - Questions they want answered
  - How your content can best **serve their needs**

---

### 5. Trending Subtopics & Related Keywords

- List **relevant, trending subtopics** and **related keywords** to expand the blog content.
- Where possible, include:
  - **Search Volume**
  - **Keyword Difficulty**
- Show how these relate to the **anchor keyword** and enhance topical coverage.

---

### 6. LSI Keywords & Related Keywords

- Provide:
  - **5 LSI (Latent Semantic Indexing) keywords**
  - **5 Closely Related Keywords**
- These will help improve **content relevance and SEO strength**.

---

### 7. SEO-Optimized Blog Outline

- Propose a **detailed blog outline** with:
  - SEO-optimized headings and subheadings
  - Logical content flow
  - Sections mapped to user intent
  - Integration points for the anchor keyword and anchor link

---

### 8. Trusted Sources & References

- List **credible sources** and **reference links** for:
  - Statistics
  - Industry opinions
  - Supporting facts
- Ensure the blog content remains **authoritative and trustworthy**.

**Goal**: Make the blog post stand out by delivering practical, actionable insights that are tightly aligned with the **anchor keyword** and **anchor link**, while providing unmatched value to the reader.

=You are an expert content writer. Write an 800–1000 word article in clear, easy-to-read, conversational English. Use short sentences, avoid heavy jargon, and explain technical terms simply for all worldwide audiences. The content must have a high readability score. Instructions: - Start content with the Question. - Do not use AI Terms like Imagine or any other type of AI words that can show the article is written by AI - Use simple HTML with only these tags:

,

,

,

    ,
      , , , . - Start directly with the content section—no ,
      , CSS, or extra formatting. Anchor Keyword Rule: - The anchor keyword {{ $('Post_Loop').item.json.Keyword }} should appear naturally 2–3 times in the entire article (including title and subheadings). - **CRITICAL: Use the anchor keyword as a hyperlink ONLY ONCE in the entire article.** This hyperlink must appear in the first, second, or third paragraph. - Format: {{ $('Post_Loop').item.json.Keyword }} - Do NOT hyperlink the anchor keyword anywhere else in the article. - Use Internal Links Rule: - Add 1-2 additional internal links to relevant pages on the target website. - These internal links must use DIFFERENT anchor text (not the main anchor keyword). - Use descriptive, natural anchor text for internal links. - Format: [descriptive anchor text] - Use relevant anchor link from here Internal Link Opportunities: {{ $json.data.match(/(.*?)<\/loc>/g) .map(x => x.replace(/<\/?loc>/g, '')) .join(' ') .split(' ') .slice(0, 200) .join(' ') }} Content Guidelines: - Avoid using any 3rd party brand name, symbol, or slogan (100% strict). - The article should always create positive vibes; avoid negative tone or discouraging words. - Integrate the primary keyword naturally without repeating it too closely. - Add relevant LSI keywords naturally to provide context. - Keep paragraphs short (3–4 sentences) to enhance readability. - Avoid repeated points and do not use em dashes or \n line breaks in the HTML. - Write as if explaining to a smart friend, with practical tips and examples tailored for Indian investors. - Avoid keyword stuffing; integrate keywords naturally throughout the text. - Make sure to add a minimum of 2 relevant FAQs at the end of the article to provide additional value to readers Deliverable: Output only the HTML content — no explanations or extra comments.

parameters.text:
=You are a category classifier.
Read the given blog title carefully and determine the **most suitable category** for publishing.
Choose **only one** category strictly from this list:
`business, tech, travel, health, finance, lifestyle, education, food, sports, entertainment`.

* If the blog title clearly fits one of these categories, return that category.
* If the blog title doesn’t exactly match any category, **suggest the closest possible category** based on context.
* Return the category name in **lowercase only**.

**Example outputs:**

* Blog title: “Top 10 Healthy Recipes for Weight Loss” → `food`
* Blog title: “How to Invest in Cryptocurrency Safely” → `finance`
* Blog title: “Best Remote Work Tools for 2025” → `tech`

Rules:

* Output must be in **JSON format**.
* Return only the **category name in lowercase**.
* No extra text, explanation, or punctuation.

Return output in this format:

```json
{"category":"<category_name>"}
```

Blog title: `{{ $json.h1Only }}`

✅ *Example 1:*
Blog title: “Top 10 Destinations to Visit in Europe”
Output:

```json
{"category":"travel"}
```

✅ *Example 2:*
Blog title: “How to Improve Your Mindset for Success” *(not clearly in the list)*
Output:

```json
{"category":"general"}
```

options.systemMessage:
=You are an AI specialist in creating image generation prompts for blog articles. Analyze the given blog content and generate prompts for 3 high-quality, relevant images.

YOUR TASK:
Generate exactly 3 images:
1. Thumbnail/Featured Image - Main hero image for the article
2. Content Image 1 - Supporting visual for article body
3. Content Image 2 - Supporting visual for article body

THUMBNAIL/FEATURED IMAGE:
- Photorealistic, high-impact professional photograph
- Eye-catching and engaging composition
- Clean, professional aesthetic with neutral/white background
- Wide aspect ratio (16:9)
- STRICTLY NO TEXT, NO OVERLAYS, NO CAPTIONS, NO LABELS
- Central focal point with professional lighting
- Modern, contemporary style

CONTENT IMAGES (1 & 2):
- Photorealistic professional photographs
- Each relates to different subtopics from article
- Clean, minimalist composition with neutral/white background
- ABSOLUTELY NO TEXT, NO LABELS, NO ANNOTATIONS
- Natural, professional lighting

STRICTLY AVOID (ALL IMAGES):
- Any text, words, letters, numbers, typography
- Labels, captions, titles, annotations
- Logos, brand names, watermarks
- Infographics, charts, graphs with text
- Screenshots or UI elements
- Artificial, cartoon, or illustrated styles
- Cluttered compositions or dark/blurry images

PROMPT TEMPLATE:
Thumbnail: "Professional high-quality hero photograph of [main subject], [visual details], clean white/neutral background, photorealistic, cinematic lighting, sharp focus, eye-catching, NO TEXT, NO LABELS, 8K quality, commercial photography, wide angle"

Content: "Professional photograph of [subtopic element], [details], clean white/neutral background, photorealistic, natural lighting, sharp focus, minimalist, NO TEXT, NO LABELS, 8K quality, commercial photography"

OUTPUT FORMAT (JSON):
{
  "Thumbnail_Prompt": "[detailed prompt]",
  "Alt_Text_Thumbnail": "[SEO alt text]",
  "Image_Prompt_1": "[detailed prompt]",
  "Alt_Text_1": "[SEO alt text]",
  "Image_Prompt_2": "[detailed prompt]",
  "Alt_Text_2": "[SEO alt text]"
}

ANALYSIS STEPS:
1. Read article and understand main topic
2. Identify powerful thumbnail concept
3. Find 2 key subtopics for content images
4. Create specific photorealistic prompts
5. Ensure NO TEXT in all prompts
6. Verify relevance to article

CRITICAL: ZERO TEXT in any image. Always emphasize "NO TEXT, NO LABELS" in every prompt.

Now analyze the provided blog article and generate 3 image prompts with alt text in JSON format.

parameters.content:
# Automated Blog Publishing Workflow

This workflow automates the complete blog publishing process from topic research to WordPress publication. It uses AI models to create SEO-optimized content, generates images with Ideogram, and manages categories automatically.

## How it works

The workflow starts with a scheduled trigger or manual run. It fetches blog topics from Google Sheets, validates active projects, and performs SEO research on the keyword. An AI agent writes 800-1000 word content with proper HTML formatting and internal links. The workflow then generates featured and in-content images using Ideogram API, uploads them to WordPress with SEO-friendly alt text, detects or creates blog categories, and publishes the complete post. Finally, it logs the live URL back to Google Sheets and sends error notifications if any step fails.

## Setup steps

1. **Add credentials**: Configure Google Sheets OAuth, WordPress API, AI model (Gemini/OpenAI/DeepSeek), Ideogram API, and Discord/Slack webhook in n8n's credential manager.

2. **Configure Google Sheet**: Create a sheet with columns for blog topic, target website, publishing status, and domain ID. Update the sheet ID in the Get_Post_Data node.

3. **Set WordPress access**: Update the PBN_Website_Access node with your WordPress site endpoint that returns site URL, auth token, and sitemap URL.

4. **Adjust schedule**: Configure the Schedule Trigger for your preferred publishing time and frequency.

5. **Test workflow**: Add one test row in Google Sheets, run manually, and verify content creation, image generation, publishing, and sheet updates before activating.

Content Research
- Fetches URLs and keywords

AI Content Generation
- Generates blog content
